issue.title: [CF 886] Sliders Ignoring Stepping, Reporting Raw Values
issue.body:
Well, I looked through the closed tickets first and found some previous tickets about this. I'm going to submit it anyway, though, just because of what I said at the bottom: Nevcairiel said that it was fixed in Ace3, so it shouldn't've required anything of you, should it have? And, moreover, why am I not seeing the fix? I changed it to an "Other" so as to not be so accusative.

What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Add a Condition, e.g. Instance Type.
2. Drag the slider.

What do you expect to happen? What happens instead?
I feel like I remember it jumping to the slider steps before. Now it's moving fluidly until you drop it and then it "snaps" to whatever step is nearest.
During the fluid movement, it shows the full floating point value for the position of the slider.

What version of TellMeWhen are you using? ("The latest" is not a version)
v6.2.6

Do you have an error log of what happened?
N/A

Please provide any additional information below (including any export strings if applicable; see above.)
I assume it's the same thing outlined in here: http://forums.wowace.com/showthread.php?t=20713
In that thread, they say it's fixed in Ace3 now, but I wonder if maybe he didn't update the minor version in AceGUI-3.0...


> Posted by CurseForge user Pelf | Imported from CurseForge issue #886 | Raw

comments.body:
TMW only uses Ace3 for the group options and a few other things.

This should be fixed in the latest alpha version: http://wow.curseforge.com/addons/tellmewhen/files/

Let me know if it isn't.
